projects.project_name: Full-Stack React and REST API (School Database)
projects.description: A Full-Stack “School Database” application utilizing a React client, SQLite database, and Express server.  The application employs sign-up, sign-in, and sign-out functionality, and persists user credentials while navigating the site.  Signed-in users are able to perform standard CRUD operations, but are restricted from updating and deleting courses created by other users.
This dynamic web application allows users to list, add, update, and delete books from a SQLite database, using an intuitive client-side interface.

This single page React application allows for users to search for photos using the Flickr API.  Implements tracking of browser history for more convenient site navigation, and generates 404-like errors for non-existent pages.  Running this application requires that you have your own Flickr API key.  For details on how to obtain a Flickr API key and run the application, please follow the instructions in the README file.

This web application utilizes AJAX and the Fetch API to get a list of random user data from the Random User Generator API, and display the data as a client-side employee directory.  Selecting a user generates a modal window, displaying additional user information, and navigation buttons to cycle through the list of users.  This site also implements a dynamic search function for the instantaneous retrieval of matched users.

Phrase Hunter is a browser-based, word guessing game.  This web application utilizes JavaScript and object oriented programing to select a random phrase for the user to guess.  Users can interact with the application using their keyboard, or by clicking letter on the onscreen keyboard.

This interactive form application utilizes JavaScript for client side validation.  The application implements basic DOM manipulation techniques to create and remove HTML elements from the web page, and generates error messages when a user tries to submit the form with missing information, or an invalid email address.
